alert.note: Alert for Allen; Butler; Chase; Chautauqua; Cowley; Elk; Greenwood; Labette; Montgomery; Neosho; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 05 at 3:12PM CDT until May 06 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Central, South Central, and Southeast Kansas, including the following counties, in Central Kansas, Chase. In South Central Kansas, Butler and Cowley. In Southeast Kansas, Allen, Chautauqua, Elk, Greenwood, Labette, Montgomery, Neosho, Wilson and Woodson. * WHEN...Until 7 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Continued moderate to heavy rainfall over areas that have already received up to 5 inches of rain. Rain threat does look to abate by the early evening. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Allen; Butler; Chase; Chautauqua; Cowley; Elk; Greenwood; Labette; Montgomery; Neosho; Wilson; Woodson
